intro: Luzula nivalis, commonly known as the snow grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to cold climates. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and slender, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in alpine and arctic regions, often in rocky or barren soils. Luzula nivalis is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, including freezing temperatures and poor nutrient availability.
